result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 9:34 a.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF904, 22CM659, 22CT173.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ, pro se. 

Date and time set for attorney review hearing. 
COURT questions deft re: status of counsel; Defendant states he has not heard from SPD office. 
COURT notes SPD office has filed status report and has not been able to find counsel. 
COURT appoints on Dean appointment, Atty Peter Rotter and caps fees at $3000.00.
COURT preserves time limits. 

COURT sets PH for 10/10/22 at 9:45 a.m., Courtroom B.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  2:52 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in custody by video from Taylor County Jail by video. 
Atty Kat Yanke from SPD office appears in person. 

Date and time set for attorney status review.  
COURT recites history; Atty Yanke makes statement re: amount of contacts made to find representation.
COURT questions defendant; Defendant states he never waived time limits at last hearing and makes arguments. 

COURT makes findings and extends time limits for good cause. 
COURT finds SPD office has made good faith effort to find counsel. 

COURT sets CC for 9/07/22 at 8:05 a.m. to get attorney review hearing set within 2 weeks in this branch; not Court Commissioner.

INCLUDES 22CM659, 22CT173 & 22CF904.  No contact with co-deft: Parnell Brown.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
